overview: Dr. Gregory Whitten joined the board in 1998 as a major investor. In 2001 he became Chairman of the Board and then in 2003 he became the Chief Executive Officer. Dr. Whitten spent 19 years at Microsoft during which time he developed Microsoftâ€™s common cross-language compiler and runtime technology, the enterprise-wide software and architecture strategies for the Office, Back Office and Windows product lines. Dr. Whittenâ€™s experiences as the chief architect of Office applications and chief architect of languages at Microsoft have been instrumental to Numerix as it continues to lead the market in cross-asset analytics.
